name: Rocket Jockey [Classic]
description:
What Is Rocket Jockey [Classic]?

Rocket Jockey Classic is a 2D platformer, where you must use your rocket launcher to "rocket jump" your way through increasingly difficult levels. VERY increasingly difficult. Sorry.

Thrust head first into the fantasy world of Archon, you must guide Sergeant Pepper through the many challenges ahead. Can you overcome the grim Forest of Doom, get across the shifting sands of the Kharé Underbelly, over the frost bitten Kestrel Mountains, and deep below through the Grave of Sinners to finally reach the top of Xarmoc Spire and find your way home? Probably not, the game is way too hard. But it's worth a shot!

To overcome these challenges, you'll need to master rocket jumping. But remember! Rockets cause no harm to the dangerous inhabitants of Archon, so your best bet will be to avoid them at all costs. 

This game was created in Unreal Engine 4 over the course of a couple months by a 4 person team enrolled in VUW's MDDN221 Game Design 1 course in 2022. The initial concept was created by me, Ben, for the first project of the course. From there the team was formed, and we spent the next couple months from 07/04/22 until 01/06/22 working on the game (in-between working on our others projects).

The game is very unpolished and flawed in many aspects, particularly in some gameplay / level design areas, which is to be expected when creating your first *proper* game (Xarmoc Spire barely counts...). However I am still super proud of the work we managed do. 

The reason it is labeled "Classic" is because I plan to work further on the project on my own, polishing up areas that need it, added new features, and just generally making the game a bit nicer to play. This version is the game as submitted, without any changes. 

Credits

Tia Corpe - Art, Animation

Matias Ermenyi - Art, Animation, Level Design Concepts, Sound Effects

Anfri Hayward - Lead Programmer, Level Design, Sound Effects, Music

Benjamin Pilbrow - Game Director, Gameplay Design, Level Design, Programming
